sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'; const CoursesContent = () => { // Sample courses data const courses = [ { id: 1, name: 'Computer Vision', instructor: 'Dr. Smith', progress: 75, color: 'bg-intel-blue' }, { id: 2, name: 'Machine Learning Fundamentals', instructor: 'Prof. Johnson', progress: 60, color: 'bg-intel-dark-blue' }, { id: 3, name: 'Deep Learning', instructor: 'Dr. Williams', progress: 40, color: 'bg-intel-light-blue' }, { id: 4, name: 'Data Visualization', instructor: 'Prof. Davis', progress: 90, color: 'bg-green-600' }, ]; return (

My Courses

Access your course materials, recorded lectures, and assignments.

{courses.map(course => (

{course.name}

Instructor: {course.instructor}

{course.progress}% complete

))}
); }; export default CoursesContent;
